alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Marion; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion, east central Taylor, western Casey and northeastern Adair Counties through 430 PM EDT/330 PM CDT/... At 357 PM EDT/257 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Liberty, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Persistent weak rotation has been noted with this storm. It may intensify. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Marion, east central Taylor, western Casey and northeastern Adair Counties, including the following locations... Peytons Store, Bass, Clementsville, Pellyton, Jacktown, Beech Bottom, Casey Creek, Atterson, Rheber and Chilton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
